Entries.Abigail: #$c .5#The valley looks more interesting in the rain... don't you think?#The lake's a beautiful place to visit when the weather's like this.
Entries.Robin: #$c .5#The rain doesn't stop me from getting a job done! ...Although soggy wood isn't a joy to work with.#Your roof isn't leaking, is it? Let me know if it that ever happens.
Entries.Demetrius: #$c .5#Greetings. Stay inside if you want to keep warm.#The low acidity of this rain should be good for your crops.
Entries.Maru: #$c .5#When it rains I have a good excuse to work on my gadgets all day. ...It must be kind of boring for you, though.#Ah, another rainy day, just like I predicted.
Entries.Sebastian: #$c .5#If you're lucky, you might see a frog in this weather.#Looks like a good day for some ocean gazing.
Entries.Linus: #$c .5#A warm rain is a pleasant way to get clean.$h#It looks like the rain doesn't bother you much, either.
Entries.Pierre: #$c .5#Most people stay indoors on days like this... It's not good for business.$s#I'm glad you made it here in the rain. The shop's been really quiet.
Entries.Caroline: #$c .5#My garden is happy today... And our water bill will be lower this month.#I hope the sun comes out soon. What did the weather report say today?
Entries.Alex: #$c .5#Hmmph. This is not good weather for sports, but... oh well, I can always lift weights inside.#Nothing like a hardcore game of mud gridball. As long as you've got buddies who are up for playing.
Entries.George: #$c .5#It's awful cold, isn't it? What a rotten day.#Why do I even bother getting out of bed when the day looks like this?
Entries.Evelyn: #$c .5#I think the roof might be leaking. In the old days, George would've scampered right up and fixed it... *sigh*$s#These days affect my energy a lot more than they used to...$s
Entries.Lewis: #$c .5#Hi there. Taking a break? Seems like a good time for one.#Goodness, I hope the river doesn't overflow...$s
Entries.Clint: #$c .5#Today would be a good day to explore the mines... Who knows, you might find some rare ores.#My shop feels even more isolated when it's raining.
Entries.Penny: #$c .5#The raindrops are really loud on the roof of our home. ...It's soothing, though.#Looks like a good day to curl up with one of my favorite books.$h
Entries.Pam: #$c .5#Howdy, kid. Stayin' dry?#Heh. Guess I'll warm up with a nice pint tonight.
Entries.Emily: #$c .5#It never rains in Calico Desert... That's where my friend Sandy lives. Wish I could've visited her today.#If you stand in the rain and listen carefully, the raindrops sound like little whispered conversations.
Entries.Haley: #$c .5#I spent all morning doing my hair... now the rain could mess it up. *sigh* ... Life is hard sometimes.$s#Yikes. No offense, but you are soaked.
Entries.Sam: #$c .5#Rain muffles sound, so I can play my guitar louder without my Mom getting mad. Hehe.$h#It feels kinda badass to walk through the rain without letting it faze you.
Entries.Leah: #$c .5#Maybe I should cook something new and exciting today. Something spicy.#I always look forward to how the forest looks all glisteny after the sun returns.
Entries.Shane: #$c .5#Hmm... this weather makes me thirsty.$u#Oh joy. Another rainy day.$s
Entries.Marnie: #$c .5#Hey there. You look like you're soaked...you poor thing!$h#Hey @. You don't have any critters stuck outside, right?
Entries.Elliott: Sometimes when I lie in bed I can hear a distant foghorn cut through the rain.#$b#But when I look out the window I see only a curtain of gray.
Entries.Gus: #$c .5#There's nothing like a glass of dry red wine on a day like this, huh? Hehehe, I love my job.#Need something to warm you up tonight? Don't be shy!
Entries.Dwarf: #$c .5#Rain... It's almost mythical to us. Some of us dwarves live our entire lives without ever experiencing it.#Humans seem to complain about rain, yet you choose to live on the surface. Why is that?
Entries.Wizard: #$c .5#Stormy days are the only time I can commune with certain elementals. I don't expect you to understand.#If you have extra time on days like these, why not enter the mines and slay a few monsters?
Entries.Harvey: #$c .5#Hi there. Er... Read anything interesting in the library lately?#Days like these make me hungry for a hot meal. How about you?
Entries.Krobus: #$c .5#Ah, the sewers are flowing quickly today. It'll get nice and humid in here... Just how I like it.#Rain is truly a lifegiving force. Give thanks to Yoba today.

Entries.jobLeave_Harvey: #$c .5#I've got some appointments today at work. I'll see you in the evening!#I have to go into the clinic today. Have a nice day, okay?
Entries.jobLeave_Penny: #$c .5#I have to go into town today. Don't work too hard, and eat something good for lunch!$h#Looks like I'm all prepared for work. Be sure to take good care of yourself today!$h
Entries.jobLeave_Maru: #$c .5#It's another work day for me. Shouldn't be too stressful! But we'll see.#I have to leave for work soon. I'll see you tonight. I'll be thinking of you!$h
Entries.jobReturn_Harvey: Hi, honey. How was your day?#$e#$c .6#My patients are still healthy, so it was a good day.#*Phew*... I'm exhausted...$s
Entries.jobReturn_Penny: #$c .7#Good evening. My day was fine, thanks! How was yours?$h#Jas and Vincent weren't behaving very well today. I'm still all wound up...
Entries.jobReturn_Maru: #$c .5#Well, it was just another boring day at the clinic.#Hey. Did you have a more exciting day than me? I hope so.#$e#Well, It's time to kick back and relax. Did you leave me any dinner?#$e#I'm just looking forward to bed-time.$h
Entries.OneKid_0: #$c .5#I've been reading this book on child development. Looks like our child is perfectly healthy.#Have you spent any time with %kid1 today?
Entries.OneKid_1: #$c .5#Phew, staying at home with a kid is teaching me how to stretch my energy further than I ever have.#I wonder if %kid1 will grow up to be a farmer like you?
Entries.OneKid_2: #$c .5#Leave the parenting to me today! I've got things under control, so be sure not to stress while you're out.#Don't worry, I'll feed %kid1 today. You can just focus on running the farm.
Entries.OneKid_3: #$c .5#I wonder what our child's favorite foods will be? Maybe something you grow yourself?#Life's a lot different now that we have a child.
Entries.TwoKids_0: #$c .5#I'm planning on having lots of little adventures with the kids today!$h#I already gave %kid1 and %kid2 their breakfast. They were hungry!
Entries.TwoKids_1: #$c .5#I'm trying to keep the kids on a schedule. It helps with everyone's sanity.#We have to make sure and give %kid1 a lot of attention now that we have %kid2. We don't want any jealousy between them.
Entries.TwoKids_2: #$c .5#With a marriage and kids, I feel like I can see further into the future of our life than ever before.#You know, I think %kid2 has your nose.
Entries.TwoKids_3: #$c .5#I'm actually glad that I've got my hands full with the children. You do so much work, so I'm glad I can contribute to our household.#A nice house, two wonderful kids, and a beautiful plot of land. What's left?
Entries.spouseRoom_Emily: #$c .5#I'm going to spend some time with the parrot today. It breaks my heart that he'll never fly again.$u#I've got some tailoring projects that need my attention today. The parrot will keep me company while you're out.

Entries.Fri.000: #$c .5#Should I let Sam win for once? ...nah.$h#Watch out! Double shot, incoming.$h
Entries.marriage_Fri.001: #$c .5#My skills haven't declined... Sam's still just as easy to beat.$h#Ahh, sweet victory. Some things never get old.$h

Entries.Birdie0: I never thought I'd see a new face on this island, dear. But I'm glad you're here!
Entries.Birdie1: It's rumored that long ago, a great civilization of dwarves lived on this very island.#$b#Have you been inside the volcano? It's filled with the ruins of their strange machines...
Entries.Birdie2: If you're ever feeling queasy in the stomach, a bite of ginger does wonders, dear...
Entries.Birdie3: Have you been to the secret shrine in the jungle? The flowers there smell lovely... It's one of my favorite spots on the island.$h
Entries.Birdie4: Every morning for breakfast, I have a bowl of poi and a glass of freshly squeezed mango juice. It keeps me young!
Entries.Birdie5: I walk the beach every day to see if anything new has washed ashore. There's a lot floating around out there!
Entries.Birdie6: My hut may be small, but it's more than enough for what I need. And best of all, I built it myself.
Entries.Birdie7: Got someone special waiting for you back on the mainland? You make sure you hold 'em close!
Entries.Birdie8: Why sure, I'll spend the rest of my days on this island. It's become my happy place.#$b#Have you found one of your own?$h
Entries.Birdie9: Should be a good day for a hike. You'll see all sorts of little critters if you keep your eyes open.
Entries.Birdie10: When I was just a tiny little girl, I wanted to be a mermaid. Looks like I came pretty close! Heh heh...
Entries.Birdie11: The sand feels good between the toes, wouldn't you say?
Entries.Birdie12: *sigh*... To live in a world of endless potential, we can never know if we've made the right choices.$s#$b#Sorry to trouble you, my dear. I sometimes get carried away by thoughts...
Entries.Birdie13: I don't know if you believe in ocean spirits, but whenever I talk to them, the fish always bite a bit more.
Entries.Birdie14: The weather is warm and lovely year round, my dear... it feels perfect for me bones...
Entries.Birdie15: Fruit, fish, and foraged food... It's a good diet! I feel as healthy as ever.
Entries.Birdie16: You've seen those Joja cargo barges, huh? I've seen one come near the island once and then turn around.#$b#Probably they were lost.
Entries.Birdie17: My husband and I never had any children. What an adventure that could have been...!#$e#There are plenty of lives I could have lived. Sometimes I wonder about those...$s#$b#...But only for a little while. It takes a bit of effort to be glad for what was.
Entries.Birdie18: Hello, dear... you look healthy and in good spirits today!$h
Entries.Birdie19: Have you seen the little banana altar in the jungle? If I had a banana I'd set it there and see what happens... heh heh...$h
Entries.Birdie20: Is it just me, or have the island spirits perked up a bit ever since you arrived?
Entries.Birdie22: I remember long ago how older folks would complain about the times changing.#$b#Well, around here, nothing much changes! Seems I dodged that one, hehe.$h
Entries.Birdie23: I've been here so long, I can't even hear the ocean anymore...
Entries.Birdie24: I think I'll take a stroll over to the secret shrine later. I have much to be thankful for each day.
Entries.Birdie25: Can you think of a happier place than this?#$b#I traveled so many places when I was young, I think I've seen all I need!
Entries.Birdie26: You do seem so dedicated to caring for living things. It takes a gentle soul to do that.#$b#But I sense you've got a tougher side, too, hmm? How many times have you been in that volcano, hmm?$h
Entries.Birdie27: The seasons must be changing soon on the mainland, huh? Which one are you going into, now?
Entries.Birdie28: It's a full moon, tonight... Whether your fortune be good or bad, be on the alert, my dear... The spirits are restless.
